questions.question: Are your medical facilities internationally accredited?

questions.question: What if I need additional procedures or complications arise?

introduction.title: Privacy Policy at a Glance
introduction.paragraph1: The protection of your data is very important to us. We want you to feel safe when visiting our website. It is important to us that you know which data is collected when using our online services and how it is used.
introduction.paragraph2: In this privacy policy, we (Sanovias Medical Tourism) inform you about the processing of personal data when using our website. Personal data is information that relates to an identified or identifiable person. This includes information that allows conclusions to be drawn about your identity, such as your name, telephone number, address or email address.
introduction.paragraph3: Statistical data that we collect when you visit our website and that cannot be linked to your person does not fall under the term personal data. You can print or save this privacy policy by using the usual functionality of your browser.

contact.title: Contact Details
contact.paragraph1: The responsible party for data processing on this website is:
contact.paragraph2: The responsible party is the natural or legal person who alone or jointly with others determines the purposes and means of processing personal data (e.g. names, email addresses, etc.).

dataProcessing.title: Scope of Data Processing, Processing Purposes and Legal Basis
dataProcessing.paragraph1: We detail the scope of data processing, processing purposes and legal basis below. The following come into consideration as legal basis for data processing:

legalBasis.consent: Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. a GDPR serves as the legal basis for processing operations for which we obtain consent.
legalBasis.contract: Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. b GDPR is the legal basis insofar as the processing of personal data is necessary for the performance of a contract, e.g. when a website visitor purchases a product from us or we provide a service for them. This legal basis also applies to processing that is necessary for pre-contractual measures, such as inquiries about our products or services.
legalBasis.legalObligation: Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. c GDPR serves as the legal basis when processing is necessary to comply with a legal obligation.
legalBasis.vitalInterests: Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. d GDPR serves as the legal basis when processing is necessary to protect vital interests.
legalBasis.publicTask: Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. e GDPR serves as the legal basis when processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest.
legalBasis.legitimateInterests: Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. f GDPR serves as the legal basis when we can invoke legitimate interests for the processing of personal data, e.g. for cookies that are necessary for the technical operation of our website.

dataTransfer.title: Data Processing Outside the EEA
dataTransfer.paragraph1: Insofar as we transfer data to service providers or other third parties outside the EEA, we guarantee the security of the data during transmission through adequacy decisions of the EU Commission (Art. 45 para. 3 GDPR) where available (e.g. for the United Kingdom, Canada and Israel).
dataTransfer.paragraph2: If no adequacy decision exists (e.g. for the USA), the legal basis for data transfer is generally standard contractual clauses. These are a set of rules adopted by the EU Commission and part of the contract with the respective third party. According to Art. 46 para. 2 lit. b GDPR, they ensure the security of data transfer.
dataTransfer.paragraph3: Many providers have given contractual guarantees beyond the standard contractual clauses that protect data beyond the standard contractual clauses. These include guarantees regarding data encryption or regarding an obligation of the third party to notify data subjects when law enforcement agencies want to access data.

retention.title: Storage Duration
retention.paragraph1: Unless expressly stated otherwise in this privacy policy, data stored with us will be deleted as soon as it is no longer required for its intended purpose and deletion does not conflict with statutory retention obligations.
retention.paragraph2: If the data is not deleted because it is required for other and legally permissible purposes, its processing will be restricted, i.e. the data will be blocked and not processed for other purposes. This applies, for example, to data that we must retain for commercial or tax law reasons.

dataRights.title: Rights of Data Subjects
dataRights.introduction: Data subjects have the following rights regarding personal data concerning them:

access.title: Right of Access
access.description: Every person affected by the processing of personal data has the right granted by the European legislator to obtain free information at any time from the data controller about the personal data stored about their person and a copy of this information. Furthermore, the European legislator has granted the data subject information about the following information:
details: the categories of personal data being processed
the recipients or categories of recipients to whom the personal data have been or will be disclosed, in particular recipients in third countries or international organizations
where possible, the planned duration for which the personal data will be stored, or, if not possible, the criteria for determining that duration
the existence of a right to rectification or erasure of personal data concerning them or to restriction of processing by the controller or a right to object to such processing
the existence of a right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority
where personal data are not collected from the data subject: any available information as to their source
the existence of automated decision-making, including profiling

rectification.title: Right to Rectification
rectification.description: Every person affected by the processing of personal data has the right granted by the European legislator to demand the immediate correction of incorrect personal data concerning them. Furthermore, the data subject has the right to request the completion of incomplete personal data, including by means of providing a supplementary statement, taking into account the purposes of the processing.

erasure.title: Right to Erasure
erasure.description: Every person affected by the processing of personal data has the right granted by the European legislator to obtain from the controller the erasure of personal data concerning them without undue delay, and the controller shall have the obligation to erase personal data without undue delay where one of the following grounds applies and processing is not necessary:
grounds: Personal data are no longer necessary in relation to the purposes for which they were collected or otherwise processed
The data subject withdraws consent and there is no other legal ground for processing
The data subject objects to processing and there are no overriding legitimate grounds for processing
Personal data have been unlawfully processed
Personal data must be erased for compliance with a legal obligation

restriction.title: Right to Restriction of Processing
restriction.description: Every person affected by the processing of personal data has the right to obtain restriction of processing where one of the following applies:
conditions: The accuracy of personal data is contested by the data subject
Processing is unlawful and the data subject opposes erasure
The controller no longer needs the personal data for processing but the data subject requires them for legal claims
The data subject has objected to processing pending verification of legitimate grounds

portability.title: Right to Data Portability
portability.description: Every person affected by the processing of personal data has the right to receive personal data concerning them in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and have the right to transmit those data to another controller where processing is based on consent or contract and carried out by automated means.

objection.title: Right to Object
objection.description: Every person affected by the processing of personal data has the right to object at any time to processing of personal data concerning them which is based on legitimate interests. The controller shall no longer process the personal data unless the controller demonstrates compelling legitimate grounds for the processing which override the interests, rights and freedoms of the data subject.

withdrawConsent.title: Right to Withdraw Consent
withdrawConsent.description: Every person affected by the processing of personal data has the right to withdraw consent to the processing of personal data at any time. The withdrawal of consent shall not affect the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.

complaint.title: Right to Lodge a Complaint
complaint.description: Data subjects also have the right to lodge a complaint with a data protection supervisory authority regarding the processing of their personal data.

dataRights.contact: If you wish to exercise any of these rights, you can contact our data protection officer or another employee of the data controller at any time using the contact details provided.

dataProvision.title: Obligation to Provide Data
dataProvision.paragraph1: Customers, prospects or third parties only need to provide us with personal data within the framework of a business relationship or other relationship that is necessary for the establishment, implementation and termination of the business relationship or other relationship or that we are legally obliged to collect.
dataProvision.paragraph2: Without this data, we will generally have to refuse to conclude a contract or provide a service or will no longer be able to carry out an existing contract or other relationship. Mandatory information is marked as such.

automatedDecision.title: No Automated Decision-Making
automatedDecision.paragraph1: To establish and carry out a business relationship or other relationship, we generally do not use fully automated decision-making according to Article 22 GDPR. Should we use these procedures in individual cases, we will inform you separately if this is required by law.

informational.title: Informational Use of the Website
informational.paragraph1: When using the website for informational purposes, i.e. when website visitors do not specifically transmit information to us, we collect the personal data that the browser transmits to our server in order to ensure the stability and security of our website. This is our legitimate interest, so the legal basis is Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. f GDPR.
dataTypes: Time zone difference to Greenwich Mean Time (GMT)
Website from which the request comes
Language and version of browser software
informational.paragraph2: This data is also stored in log files. It is deleted when its storage is no longer necessary, at the latest after 14 days.

webhosting.title: Web Hosting and Website Provision
webhosting.paragraph1: We host our website with a hosting service provider. The use of hosting services is based on Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR. We have a legitimate interest in the most reliable presentation of our website possible.
webhosting.paragraph2: We have concluded a data processing agreement (DPA) with the hosting provider. This is a contract required by data protection law that ensures that the hosting provider only processes the personal data of our website visitors according to our instructions and in compliance with the GDPR.

ssl.title: SSL/TLS Encryption
ssl.paragraph1: This site uses SSL or TLS encryption for security reasons and to protect the transmission of confidential content, such as orders or inquiries that you send to us as the site operator. You can recognize an encrypted connection by the fact that the address line of the browser changes from "http://" to "https://" and by the lock symbol in your browser line.
ssl.paragraph2: If SSL or TLS encryption is activated, the data you transmit to us cannot be read by third parties.

contactForm.title: Contact Form
contactForm.paragraph1: When contacting us via the contact form on our website, we store the data requested there and the content of the message. The legal basis for processing is our legitimate interest in responding to inquiries directed to us. The legal basis for processing is therefore Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. f GDPR.
contactForm.paragraph2: We delete the data arising in this context after storage is no longer necessary, or restrict processing if statutory retention obligations exist.

medicalInquiries.title: Medical Inquiries and Consultations
medicalInquiries.paragraph1: When you submit medical inquiries or request consultations through our website, we process your health data to provide medical tourism services. This includes treatment preferences, medical history information you provide, and consultation records.
medicalInquiries.paragraph2: The legal basis for processing health data is your explicit consent (Art. 9 para. 2 lit. a GDPR) and processing necessary for healthcare purposes (Art. 9 para. 2 lit. h GDPR). We only process the minimum health data necessary to provide our services.
medicalInquiries.paragraph3: Health data is subject to special protection and is only accessible to authorized personnel involved in your care coordination. We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect this sensitive data.

bookings.title: Medical Treatment Bookings
bookings.paragraph1: When booking medical treatments through our website, we process personal data including medical preferences, travel information, and payment details to arrange your medical tourism package.
bookings.paragraph2: The legal basis for processing is the performance of our service contract with you (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. b GDPR). For health data, we rely on your explicit consent (Art. 9 para. 2 lit. a GDPR).

newsletter.title: Newsletter
newsletter.paragraph1: We reserve the right to inform customers who have already used our services or purchased goods from time to time by email or other electronic means about our offers, provided they have not objected. The legal basis for this data processing is Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. f GDPR. Our legitimate interest lies in direct marketing.
newsletter.paragraph2: Customers can object to the use of their email address for advertising purposes at any time without additional costs, for example via the link at the end of each email or by email to our email address mentioned above.
newsletter.paragraph3: Interested parties have the opportunity to subscribe to a free newsletter. We process the data provided during registration exclusively for sending the newsletter. Registration is done by selecting the appropriate field on our website or by another clear action whereby interested parties declare their consent to the processing of their data, so the legal basis is Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. a GDPR.
newsletter.paragraph4: Consent can be withdrawn at any time, e.g. by clicking the appropriate link in the newsletter or by notification to our email address given above. The processing of data until withdrawal remains lawful even in case of withdrawal.

thirdPartyServices.introduction: We use various third-party services to provide and improve our website functionality:

analytics.paragraph1: We may use analytics services to understand how visitors use our website. These services help us improve our website performance and user experience.
analytics.paragraph2: The legal basis for using analytics is our legitimate interest in website optimization (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR). Where required, we obtain your consent.

maps.paragraph2: The legal basis is our legitimate interest in providing location information for our medical tourism services (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR).

socialMedia.paragraph2: When users of the networks contact us via our profiles, we process the data communicated to us in order to answer the inquiries. Our legitimate interest lies in this, so the legal basis is Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. f GDPR.

whatAreCookies.title: What Are Cookies?
whatAreCookies.paragraph1: Cookies are small text files that are placed on your device (computer, smartphone, or tablet) when you visit our website. They help us provide you with a better experience by remembering your preferences and understanding how you use our site.
whatAreCookies.paragraph2: Cookies contain information that is transferred to your device's hard drive and stored there. They cannot run programs or deliver viruses to your device, and they cannot access your personal files.

howWeUseCookies.title: How We Use Cookies
howWeUseCookies.introduction: We use cookies for several purposes to improve your experience and ensure our website functions properly. Our cookies are categorized as follows:

essential.title: Essential Cookies (Always Active)
essential.description: These cookies are strictly necessary for our website to function properly. They enable basic functionality such as page navigation, form submissions, and security features. You cannot opt out of these cookies as they are essential for the service you requested.
essential.legal: Legal basis: Article 6(1)(b) GDPR - performance of contract and Article 6(1)(f) GDPR - legitimate interests in website security and functionality.

functional.title: Functional Cookies (Requires Consent)
functional.description: These cookies enhance your experience by remembering your preferences and settings. They enable features like language selection and form auto-save functionality.
functional.legal: Legal basis: Article 6(1)(a) GDPR - consent. You can withdraw your consent at any time through our cookie settings.

management.title: Managing Your Cookie Preferences
management.paragraph1: You have full control over which cookies we set on your device. You can manage your preferences through our cookie banner that appears when you first visit our site, or by adjusting your browser settings.
management.paragraph2: Please note that disabling certain cookies may impact the functionality of our website. Essential cookies cannot be disabled as they are necessary for basic website operation and security.
management.paragraph3: To update your cookie preferences on our website, you can access the cookie settings through the cookie banner or contact us directly.

platform.title: Platform Services
platform.description: Connection with certified medical providers in Tunisia, treatment information, cost estimates, and provider comparison tools.

consultation.title: Medical Consultation
consultation.description: Online consultations, telemedicine services, medical assessments, and treatment recommendations through our partner network.

coordination.title: Travel Coordination
coordination.description: Complete travel planning including accommodation booking, airport transfers, appointment scheduling, and local support services.

records.title: Medical Records Management
records.description: Secure storage and management of medical documents, treatment history, and communication with healthcare providers.

disclaimer.title: Important Notice
disclaimer.description: Sanovias acts as an intermediary platform. We do not provide direct medical services but facilitate connections with qualified medical professionals and institutions.

registration.title: Registration by the Contracting Party
registration.paragraph1: To access our full range of services, patients may register on our platform by providing accurate and complete information about their identity and medical needs.
registration.paragraph2: Registration is voluntary but recommended to receive personalized service, secure communication, and access to your medical records and treatment history.
registration.paragraph3: By registering, you agree to provide truthful information and maintain the security of your account credentials.

patient.title: Service Recipient
patient.description: The registered patient or authorized representative seeking medical tourism services through our platform.

platformUsage.paragraph2: Once you accept a treatment offer through our platform, you become committed to that specific treatment plan and associated costs as outlined in your personalized quote.
platformUsage.paragraph3: Cancellation policies and refund terms vary by treatment and provider, and will be clearly communicated before commitment.

commitment.title: Treatment Commitment
commitment.description: By accepting a treatment offer, you enter into a binding agreement for the specified medical services, travel arrangements, and associated costs.

content.paragraph2: We strive to maintain accurate and up-to-date information but cannot guarantee the completeness or accuracy of all content. Medical information should always be verified with qualified healthcare professionals.
content.paragraph3: Users are responsible for evaluating the suitability of treatments and providers based on their individual medical needs and circumstances.

usageRights.paragraph2: You may not use our platform for any commercial purposes, reproduce our content, or attempt to reverse engineer our systems.

guarantee.paragraph2: While we work with certified medical providers, we cannot guarantee specific medical outcomes. Treatment results depend on individual circumstances and medical conditions.
guarantee.paragraph3: We provide our platform services "as is" and make no warranties regarding specific results or outcomes from using our services.

liability.paragraph1: Sanovias Medical Tourism acts as an intermediary platform and is not liable for the medical services provided by third-party healthcare providers.
liability.paragraph2: Our liability is limited to the direct costs of our platform services and does not extend to medical outcomes, travel-related issues, or indirect damages.
liability.paragraph3: Users are advised to obtain appropriate travel and medical insurance to cover potential risks associated with medical tourism.

medical.title: Medical Liability Disclaimer
medical.description: We are not responsible for medical outcomes, complications, or adverse events related to treatments received through our partner providers. Medical liability rests with the treating healthcare professionals and institutions.

dataProtection.paragraph1: We are committed to protecting your personal and medical information in accordance with applicable data protection laws including GDPR.
dataProtection.paragraph2: Medical information is handled with the highest level of confidentiality and is only shared with authorized healthcare providers involved in your care.

reference.title: Privacy Policy Reference
reference.description: For detailed information about how we collect, use, and protect your data, please refer to our comprehensive Privacy Policy.

confidentiality.paragraph1: All medical information shared through our platform is subject to strict confidentiality requirements and professional medical ethics.
confidentiality.paragraph2: We maintain secure systems and protocols to protect the confidentiality of your medical records and communications.
confidentiality.paragraph3: Medical information is only disclosed to authorized healthcare providers directly involved in your treatment or as required by law.

electronicCommunication.paragraph2: Important medical and administrative communications will be sent through secure channels to protect your privacy.
electronicCommunication.paragraph3: You may opt out of marketing communications at any time while continuing to receive essential service-related messages.

changes.paragraph1: We may update these Terms from time to time to reflect changes in our services, legal requirements, or business practices.
changes.paragraph2: Material changes will be communicated to registered users via email or platform notifications at least 30 days before they take effect.
changes.paragraph3: Continued use of our services after changes take effect constitutes acceptance of the updated Terms.

finalProvisions.paragraph3: These Terms constitute the entire agreement between you and Sanovias Medical Tourism regarding the use of our services.
